Qualifiers.scope: Standards for carport dimensions and structure.
Qualifiers.applicability: Applies to structures defined as 'carport' or 'covered space' for parking, as depicted in plan and elevation views.
Qualifiers.exclusions: None specified in the provided text.

Variables.description: The open length of the carport, shown along the side of the parking space.
The open width of the carport at the vehicle entrance.
The open height from the driveway/parking surface to the bottom of the roof system.
The open width at the entrance, as shown in the plan view.
Elements supporting the roof, specifically corner columns.

Constants.notes: The label 'One of 2 corner columns' is ambiguous. See Ambiguous_Language section for details.

mandatory: The longitudinal dimension alongside the parking space must be a minimum of 20 feet open.
The front horizontal opening width must be a minimum of 10 feet open.
The vertical clearance must be a minimum of 7 feet open from the parking surface to the bottom of the roof system.
The transverse dimension at the entrance must be 'open'. A specific numeric value is not provided.
The structure must be supported by corner columns.

Relationships.hierarchical: The top-level rule 'Carport Standards' is defined by a set of dimensional and structural requirements. These requirements are specified across different views: a Plan View (Figure 29) and two Elevation Views (Figure 30).

cross_references.item_2: Figure 29 (Plan View) and Figure 30 (Left Side Elevation)
cross_references.relationship: The same requirement is specified in two different views, confirming its application to the carport's length.

cross_references.item_2: Figure 30 (Left Side Elevation) and Figure 30 (Front Elevation)
cross_references.relationship: The same requirement is specified for both side and front views, indicating a uniform minimum height for the entire covered space.
The presence of corner columns as a structural element is noted in all provided views.
Conflicting page numbers are present in the source text, which may indicate a transcription or document assembly error.

Relationships.logical_dependencies: Overall compliance is dependent on satisfying all specified minimum dimensional requirements (length, width, and height) simultaneously.

Ambiguous_Language.issue: The requirement is stated as 'open' without a specific minimum numerical dimension. This prevents quantitative validation. It may be intended to match the '10' min open' from the Front Elevation, but this is not explicitly stated.

It is unclear if this is a prescriptive requirement that a carport must have exactly two corner columns (implying a specific design, e.g., attached to another structure) or if it is a descriptive label on a diagram that happens to show two. This ambiguity affects structural validation.
